title: Why does Soraka's W have a mana cost on top of a health cost?
body:
I mean yeah it's a low cost, but if she's constantly cutting her health to heal her teammates, I don't really think she needs a mana cost on it.
And yes she can recover her health with her Q but it moves extremely slow and it's not that hard to dodge because it gives a pretty cure indication that it's landing.

Her Q costs a decent amount of mana already.

replies.body: Because rito doesn't like heals.
Just look at {{champion:432}}, he leaves a totem that heals as much as Taric does in a instant, but it costs more.
Eh, Bard's also gives movement speed, and most importantly, it can be 'stored', up to 3 of them. Which means potentially 3x as much healing when needed.

360 manas worth of heals. That heal up to 230 each, so 720 (+135% AP) worth. With 1000 AP. This goes up to 1350 or 2070 health regained. Places one every 12 (or less seconds) and must wait 10 seconds to be the full amount.

For 300 manas worth of heals, Taric heals 220 each, so 660 (+30% AP) (+15% Taric's health, so if Taric has 3000 health, that's 450). So, 790 (+90% AP). Taric also gets healed for this amount. With 500 AP, Taric heals 450 bonus, or 1240. Must wait 18/17/16/15/14 seconds (or less) to heal again, heals can go to 16/15/14/13/12 seconds with passive, and go down by 6 seconds in total with all abilities used for 12/11/10/9/8 (or less) seconds for reuse. 

That means, for every 3 heals Bard uses (at max level and waits for max heal) Taric can heal (at max level with passive) 5 or more times, sub totaling to 1100 (+150% AP) (+25% Taric's health) worth of heal. So with 500 AP and 3000 health, Taric can heal up to (+750 worth in AP) (+750 in health) to equal 2600 health that Taric can heal. And this is the least amount of possible heals.

Besides, the totems must me stood on to work, anyone can come by and take one and whoops, your down one for your ADC. Taric's are point and click. Sure, Bard can do that too, but it only does the small effect. And leaving a totem I can come by and step on isn't that safe. As someone who's played Bard a lot on the PBE, he's only stronger than Zilean, who to me is possibly the weakest support right now. His kit is made for supporting, +8% EXP, 1.1 to 1.5 second stun, bonus MS or enemy slow, and revive, but his early game is weak as ever. +8% EXP is somewhat useless as is. I wish Zilean had a more useful passive.

Been playing bard  (got him for free :/) I found his totems to be wonderfully useful, Leave 1 top, Leave 1 mid, and leave 1 for my jungler.

No other support can do this, and in a pinch the movement speed boost has saved my teams asses a few times now, might not be the strongest but it is certainty more versatile then any of the other heals, the mana cost is easily made up by grabbing a couple chimes.

Those shrines are there because Bard has to leave half the time to buff his passive. You honestly leave bot, with 3 shrines for your ADC to go and come back, go and come back, just so you can be useful. I love Bard and all, but I've mained both Taric on my main server and bard on the PBE and Taric is stronger with more of a kit. Not only the heal, but a stun that doesn't leave the enemy untouchable, a armor reduction and bonus, and bonus AD **and AP** for allies after a burst damage.

Because they hate her. I understand they don't want infinite sustain but Soraka could use a buff, and her heal is definitely the best place to start. Basically her solo laning and infinite sustain is the only thing keeping Riot from wanting her to be good. By removing the mana cost from her heal, they would not touch her solo laning but make her a tad more viable as support. For a Q that is so easy to dodge, a bugged E that you can jump out of before being silenced, she needs some more reliability.

Removing the mana cost on her W is the perfect solution.

I think Soraka is in a good spot atm. Her heal has a low CD which keeps your tank and adc live longer in skirmishes. Yes she does hurt herself when she uses it but she has her q and ult to heal herself. She's pretty hard to lane against if she gains mana regen. A heal from her q is almost equal to the health she loses from healing her allies. Her spells are pretty slow but the range is far and aoe size is as big as Oriannas ult. Her playstyle is similar to janna. She needs to be far from danger to be able to be good in teamfights. Silence is pretty valuable these days too. Her silence is aoe and lasts pretty long, of course you can walk out of it easily but walking just makes you vulnerable to a few aa and cc. They needs to fix the bug on her e.
Taking out her mana cost on heals is bad. If they did that her rate of harass and zoning is doubled. Pardon my English, not my first language

Honestly, just keep me from accidentally healing minions, and we're golden.  Last game I played as Raka I literally missed about 3 heals because I accidentally healed a minion that was on top of my champion.  All it takes is a priority code for lowest health champions then lowest health minions.

Edit:  Also, make the HP a flat amount.  Keep it scaled at about 10% of max health early game, but have it taper off into the late game.  Instead of costing 10% health and 20 mana, have it cost a flat amount that starts off at about 10% health, and have that and the mana cost increase slightly each time you level the heal as a tradeoff.  That way it will still cost health and mana, but instead of being a target for one aa to kill you, you'll instead just be OOm.  Raka's just too easy to quickly love tap to death if you spam heal.

Because if it only... only... required health? People like me would make my teammates immortal, forever, at max CDR.  You see because I can pump my AP and my Health Regen through the roof, without ever deviating from a solid support/aura build.  Ontop of this I'd have good AP, and be a walking tank that spit out slows with everything I did, while making my team faster.  I'd never care about raising my mana, except a few of the items help mana out a bit, but I really don't -require- those any more either.  I can swap out for more heavy built items, and with a rune and mastery setup my AP and gold is going to grow no matter what.  So either it needs both, or a pure mana cost.  Because by forcing me to focus on mana regen and how much mana I have, you're limiting how broad a spectrum I can focus on, and you're limiting me to not being able to take on almost every role in the game except ADC... all at once.
